channel.title: hiking on Peaks and Plains
channel.description: Recent content in hiking on Peaks and Plains

item.title: Ha Ling Peak III
item.description: Sunrise hikes are a hard sell but they are a bit easier during the winter when you can wake up a bit later. Jonathan, Chris, and I were blessed with a stunning sunrise today, which made the 4 am wake up worth it. Date: 2020-11-22 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Chris, Jonathan We started hiking in the dark at 6 am and made it to the summit just before sunrise. I overestimated my ability to bound up the last grind at the end and found myself huffing and puffing my way up there, as usual!

item.title: Pocaterra Ridge
item.description: Kat and I attempted the ever-popular Pocaterra Ridge hike for the first time on Thanksgiving weekend. We didn’t arrive particularly early but we still somehow ended up being the first ones there. With the fresh snow that had fallen, we had to break trail for most of the hike. It was definitely challenging to navigate terrain for a hike we’d never done before, but we eventually made our way to the summit.

item.title: Helen Lake
item.description: A classic fall-hike-turned-winter-then-back-to-fall-again with the folks. The original plan was to do Larch Valley/Eiffel Peak/Sentinel Pass but we didn’t head out early enough to get a spot in the parking lot. Helen Lake/Cirque Peak was our backup and it turned out to be a delightful hike! The brief snow storm we encountered was magical rather than scary, and resulted in some stunning “winter” views. We didn’t end up attempting Cirque Peak since it was too snowy and it was getting late in the day.

item.title: Skoki Loop
item.description: The Lake Louise/Skoki area in fall is to die for. This was a fun and laid back weekend trip in almost-optimal conditions. Date: 2020-09-11 to 2020-09-13 Location: Banff National Park Friends: Chris, Kat, Nick, Mel, John, Eric Day 1 - Fish Creek trailhead to Hidden Lake campground Half of us headed out fairly late in the afternoon and got to camp just in time to set up our tent before the sun went down.

item.title: Burstall Pass
item.description: A beautiful, bluebird day! Some fun stream crossings and the best part: there weren’t many people on this hike. Next time, I would love to go a bit further and make it to Leman Lake. Date: 2020-08-16 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Mom and dad

item.title: Big Beehive
item.description: It was a super busy day and we were only able to get parking due to a stroke of good luck. The goal was to hike to the plain of the six glaciers but we were distracted along the way and never made it there… Date: 2020-08-09 Location: Banff Friends: The parents Mount Rundle over Vermillion Lake.

item.title: Mount Bourgeau
item.description: What a summer this has been! Wonderful hikes, amazing weather, and so many great photos. Mount Bourgeau (and Harvey Pass) might be my new favourite day hike. The approach was yet again very long and uneventful. After two hours, we arrived at Bourgeau Lake, which to me was a less awe-inspiring Rockbound Lake. Luckily, it was a short and easy climb past Bourgeau Lake to the spectacular Harvey Pass. Upon reaching the pass, I felt like I had arrived in some sort of paradise on earth: glacial lakes, lush green alpine meadows, fields of wildflowers, and crystal-clear streams, all surrounded by towering mountains.

item.title: Rockwall
item.description: Rockwall Trail is my new favourite backpacking trip. There was so much to love about this hike: stupendous views every day, great company, sunny and warm weather, wonderful campgrounds, endless fields of wildflowers, epic towering mountains and glaciers, and abundant streams, rivers, creeks, and waterfalls. On a personal note, the lack of knee pain (unlike last year) made the hike even more enjoyable. My friends and I completed the hike North to South in three nights staying at Helmet Falls, Tumbling Creek, and Floe Lake, which I think was ideal in terms of pacing and daily distance/elevation gain.

item.title: Nihahi Ridge
item.description: Kat and I attempted Nihahi Ridge while Greg and Chris biked the Elbow loop. This turned out to be a great idea. We were also trying to take it easy the weekend before our big trip. Nihahi Ridge as a hike has never excited me but it turned out to be fun, especially the super-steep and slippery slopes, and the hands-on parts near the summit. We did not quite make it to the South summit but it was a good challenge.

item.title: Rockbound Lake
item.description: A very long forested approach, but the lake was quite nice, especially from up high. It was also surprisingly cold at the lake compared with the forest. I can’t wait to come back and climb Castle Mountain. Date: 2020-07-18 Location: Banff Friends: Ingrid, Kat The lake was constantly changing colours depending on the sunlight and clouds moving across the sky. A hiking lesson I’ve learned: it’s always worth it to try getting above a lake if you can - the colours are so much better from above.

item.title: Mount Allan II
item.description: A hot and sunny day that wasn’t too unbearable due to the wind. The hike was decently busy and a great challenge. Got briefly lost during the scrambling part (again), but it was fun! Date: 2020-07-11 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Kat, Robyn There’s Pigeon from last weekend!

item.title: Pigeon Mountain
item.description: I was so impressed with this beautiful hike! Pigeon mountain is not too strenuous but still long and high enough to be a good workout. The views are amazing - both along the way and at the summit. The trail is just a straightforward stroll to the top and back down and the trailhead is only an hour away from Calgary. Date: 2020-07-05 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Ingrid, Kat The hike begins along a transmission line right-of-way for the first 5 kilometres.

item.title: Cox Hill via North Jumpingpound Ridge
item.description: The hike We hiked this one-way from the north end of Jumpingpound Ridge to Cox Hill and down to the Dawson equestrian area. The rest of the family biked a big loop from the parking lot. The hike was a gentle hike up and down but I heard it was pretty strenuous to mountain bike. The wildflowers were still out in full bloom and my favourite part of the hike was the open meadow between Jumpingpound Ridge and Cox Hill.

item.title: Little Lougheed
item.description: Another short and fun hike with a great view of Spray Lake. I’ve never seen so many people parked on the side of the road on the Smith-Dorrien - everyone seems to be itching to get out these days. The hike was busy but there was plenty of space for groups to pass each other. Date: 2020-06-20 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Kat The lower third of the hiking trail goes through pleasant green forest.

item.title: King Creek Ridge
item.description: King Creek Ridge has an excellent effort-to-reward ratio, as can be seen from the photos. How lucky are Calgarians to see these views in the morning and still be home in time for lunch? The hike is very similar to Prairie Mountain in terms of length and elevation gain, but the views are out of the world for the amount of time you spend climbing. We ascended and descended via two different well-worn trails.

item.title: Jumpingpound Summit
item.description: The shortest hike I’ve done in years and it still kicked my ass! It’s rough coming out of quarantine mode. Date: 2020-06-06 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Katrin, Chris

item.title: Prairie Mountain II
item.description: One of the best feelings in the world is reaching a summit when you haven’t been outside in a while. The weather was nice and the rain at the trailhead turned into magical fluffy snowflakes a third of the way up. At the summit, any views were obstructed by fog. With the oppressive gloom pressing down around us, and the persistent drone of an airplane somewhere above, our time on the summit felt unsettling and eerie and somewhat post-apocalyptic.

item.title: Mount St. Piran
item.description: This was my attempt to squeeze in one last hike before the hiking season “officially” ended. There had been a lot of snowfall in parts of Kananaskis but barely any in Lake Louise. Asking around resulted in various conflicting reports of avalanche and winter conditions. We decided to head out to the Lake Louise area and check the conditions out for ourselves. There was probably a foot of snow at higher elevations, but everything was otherwise very hikeable.

item.title: Skyline Trail
item.description: Skyline was probably the hike that first led me to backpacking. I discovered it two years ago in 2016⁄17 and since then, was obsessed with the thought of hiking it. Now that I’ve actually done it, it feels strange! The weather was good, the views were great, the company was awesome, I packed my gear really well (light), the only thing that wassn’t good were my knees. Date: 2019-08-03 to 2019-08-05

item.title: Windtower
item.description: Another “easy scramble” with high payoff. Nonstop views from the moment you get past treeline. Tried this hike last year and did not make it past West Wind Pass due to weather. Bit of easy scrambling/route finding after the pass. All trails eventually lead to the same place, and lots of people to follow if you get lost. Views of Spray Lake along the way are classic. All in all, my kind of hike!

item.title: Mount Hoffman
item.description: Someone brought some steaks and cooked them in a cast iron skillet at the “summit”. It was that kind of hike. Date: 2019-07-13 Location: Kananaskis Friends: All the friends

item.title: Egypt Lake
item.description: Redemption for the attempt last year! Lots of friends, lots of fun. Date: 2019-06-29 to 2019-07-01 Location: Banff Friends: Chris, Kat, Nick, Ivan, Eric, Tess, Evan

item.title: Midnight Peak
item.description: Date: 2019-06-22 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Kat, Devin

item.title: Old Coach Trail
item.description: Date: 2019-04-26 Location: Kootenay National Park Friends: Tess, Michelle

item.title: Sulphur Mountain
item.description: It was icy going up. We took the gondola on the way down. Date: 2018-11-03 Location: Banff Friends: Ab, Chris

item.title: Healy Pass
item.description: That day, a valiant attempt was made to backpack to Egypt Lake. It was also probably the most miserable, soggy, muddy, and nasty walk I’ve ever had. An entire day of trudging up small rivers in the chilly gloom. By the time we made it to the pass, the sunlight and gorgeous sights cheered us up, but we decided to head back since everyone’s shoes were wet at that point.

item.title: Larch Valley and Eiffel Peak
item.description: Date: 2018-09-15 Location: Banff Distance: 14 km Elevation gain: 600 m Time: 7 h Friends: Chris, Eric, Nick, Ken

item.title: Picklejar Lakes
item.description: A fun outing with friends. There are quite a few lakes at the end of the hike, and amazing colours during fall. Date: 2018-09-08 Location: Kananaskis Friends: A bunch

item.title: Mount Allan
item.description: Mount Allan is long, strenuous, rewarding, not best of all, has no exposure. You get to hike to the top of Nakiska ski resort, then hike up even higher! This was a perfect day. Date: 2018-09-01 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Ken, Jonathan, Ivan, Nick

item.title: Sparrowhawk Tarns
item.description: Between the gentle incline, pretty landscape, abundant fossils, and fields of whistling marmots, this was an enjoyable day hike. Unfortunately, the wildfires were going full force at the time. Date: 2018-08-25 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Ab

item.title: Lake Minnewanka and Aylmer Peak
item.description: The First backpacking trip! There were some bear scares, and some other scares too, and I had no idea what I was doing most of the time. Still a wonderful weekend with many good memories made. I never actually made it up Mount Aylmer - the summit photos where taken by Chris. Date: 2018-08-04 to 2018-08-06 Location: Banff Friends: Chris, Nick, Spencer, Lucy Trailhead: Lake Minnewanka parking lot

item.title: Barrier Lake Lookout
item.description: Also known as Prairie View Lookout. Also known as Yates Mountain. A short hike on a scorchingly hot day. Date: 2018-07-28 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Ivan, Nick, Kristie, Yakov, Carl, Yaw

item.title: Upper Kananaskis Lake
item.description: Weekend camping trip with friends at Boulton Creek Campground. We walked part of the way around Upper Kananaskis Lake - always a beauty! Date: 2018-07-20 to 2018-07-21 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Sonia, Lisa, Michelle, Tess, Annie, Alecia, Connie

item.title: Table Mountain, Road trip through Castle and Waterton
item.description: Canada Day road trip through Castle and Waterton park. Date: 2018-06-30 to 2018-07-02 Location: Castle Provincal Park, Waterton National Park Friends: Chris, and a caravan along the way Drive to Castle We started off with the most scenic drive down Highway 533, then Highway 22 - also known as Cowboy Trail. I don’t think this highway has ever disappointed me with its views. Castle Falls was a gorgeous and quiet campground, filled with the rushing sound of water from the nearby Castle Falls.

item.title: Wasootch Ridge
item.description: After walking down a riverbed for ten minutes, we realized that we were heading down the wrong trail and had to turn back to the parking lot. Despite the great weather and open views, this hike didn’t do it for me. Maybe it was the endless, unsatisfying ups and downs of the ridgewalk, or the unchanging views which got old after a few hours. We did not make it very far down the ridge before we turned back.

item.title: Ha Ling Peak II
item.description: Date: 2018-05-20 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Mom and dad

item.title: Rawson Lake
item.description: Date: 2018-01-15 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Dad, Luselle, Jemma

item.title: West Wind Pass
item.description: A Wind Tower attempt. We made it to the pass, took a look at the snow-covered slopes above us, and decided to turn back. It was a chilly day and the pass was indeed windy! Date: 2017-10-21 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Chris

item.title: Galatea Creek Trail
item.description: Great conditions in late fall. The hike felt longer than it looked on paper. We were caught in a snow squall at the second Galatea Lake so we turned back and didn’t make it to the third one. Date: 2017-10-08 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Mom and dad

item.title: Powderface Ridge
item.description: A relaxed outing on a lovely fall day. Date: 2017-09-16 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Alecia, Lisa, Sonia

item.title: Chester Lake
item.description: A quick and easy hike with friends. Larches abound in this area. Date: 2017-09-10 Location: Kananaskis Friends: All the friends

item.title: Yamnuska
item.description: We ended up bushwacking down but it was still fun! Date: 2017-09-04 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Chris, Sonia, Nic, Michelle

item.title: Moose Mountain
item.description: A casual hike right outside of Calgary. I’ve been wanting to hike Moose Mountain for a while now. It was a bluebird day and even though the annual Moose Mountain Trail Race was going on, we didn’t pass by many people – always a plus! Date: 2017-08-26 Location: Kananaskis Distance: 15 km Elevation gain: 515 m Time: 5 hours, including a one-hour lunch break Friends: Jonathan, Michelle, Nic, Emily, Connor

item.title: Ha Ling Peak and Miner’s Peak
item.description: Short and super-popular. Steep going up with some scrambling at the top. Date: 2017-08-19 Location: Kananaskis Distance: 7 km Elevation gain: 740 m Time: 4 h, including some long breaks Friends: Mario, Chris No photos from the initial ascent, which was on a well-marked trail through forest. Shortly after clearing the treeline, it gets a lot rockier and steeper. Miner’s Peak is right beside Ha Ling Peak. All these people taking different routes to the summit.

item.title: Ptarmigan Cirque
item.description: A short and popular trail that also happened to be really pretty. Drove an hour and a half to Highwood Pass, the highest paved pass in Canada. It was 30 degrees in Calgary but felt about 17 up in the cirque because of the high elevation. Date: 2017-07-25 Location: Kananaskis Distance: 6.5 km (started scrambling up Mount Rae) Elevation gain: 300 m Time: 2 hours (including long-ish breaks) Friends: Chris, Mario

item.title: South End of Mount Lawson
item.description: Date: 2017-07-02 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Mom and Dad

item.title: Prairie Mountain
item.description: Date: 2017-06-11 Location: Kananaskis Friends: Chris, Mario, Julia
